user_input: Which NGAP procedure is used for inter-system load balancing? [3GPP Release 17]
response: both eventtriggered and periodic intersystem load reporting are supported for intersystem load balancing.
reference: uplink ran configuration transfer.

user_input: What is covered by enhanced application layer support for V2X services? [3GPP Release 17]
response: the enhanced application layer support for v2x services will include the support of v2x map dynamic information v2x ue measurement reporting usage and management of the range qos parameter and the v2x group management and group communication.
reference: advanced v2x services.

user_input: What does the Load-Balancing steering mode do? [3GPP Release 17]
response: the loadbalancing steering mode splits the traffic of a data flow in uplink and downlink direction separately across the 3gpp and non3gpp accesses with selected percentages by the ue and the upf.
reference: splits the traffic of a data flow across 3gpp and non3gpp accesses.

user_input: What is the main objective of intent driven management for service or network management? [3GPP Release 17]
response: according to 3gpp tr22841 3 the main objective of intent driven management is to reach a certain stateposition for a specific entity.
reference: to reduce the complexity of management for network resources.

user_input: What does MINT stand for? [3GPP Release 17]
response: mint stands for mobile network selection.
reference: minimization of service interruption.

user_input: What is the purpose of the Media Streaming AF Event Exposure work item? [3GPP Release 17]
response: the media streaming af event exposure work item aims at the support of generic ue data collection reporting and event exposure as well as the support for encrypted and highvalue content.
reference: to support data collection and event exposure by an af to event consumers.

user_input: What is the purpose of load-balancing steering mode enhancements? [3GPP Release 17]
response: the loadbalancing steering mode enhancements aim to maximize the aggregated throughput for a given data flow in the uplink and downlink direction by allowing the ue and the upf to select the percentage for each access independently based on rtt measurements.
reference: to enable the ue and upf to freely select split percentages for each access type.

user_input: What is a capability added in the V2X Application Enabler (VAE) layer? [3GPP Release 17]
response: a capability added in the v2x application enabler vae layer includes the support for dynamic group management.
reference: v2x service discovery.

user_input: What is the purpose of the Edge Data Network (EDN) in enabling edge applications? [3GPP Release 17]
response: the purpose of the edge data network edn is to enable edge applications over 3gpp networks.
reference: to host the edge application servers and edge enabler server ees.

user_input: What are the three features specified in TS 23.304 for 5G ProSe Direct Communication over NR based PC5 reference point? [3GPP Release 17]
response: 5g prose direct communication over nr based pc5 reference point supports broadcast mode groupcast mode and unicast mode.
reference: broadcast mode groupcast mode unicast mode.

user_input: How is service continuity supported for specific slice(s)? [3GPP Release 17]
response: multicarrier resource sharing or resource repartitioning allows a slice to use resources from the shared pool orand prioritized pool when its own dedicated or prioritized resources are not available and the use of unused resources in the prioritized pool is as specified in ts 28541.
reference: through multicarrier resource sharing or resource repartitioning.

user_input: How can UE power consumption due to false paging alarms be reduced? [3GPP Release 17]
response: according to clause 783 ue power consumption due to false paging alarms can be reduced by subdividing the group of ues monitoring the same po into multiple subgroups and indicating via associated paging early indication pei whether a subgroup shall monitor pdcch in its po.
reference: by dividing ues into multiple subgroups.

user_input: What is the purpose of Generic Bootstrapping Architecture (GBA) in 5GC? [3GPP Release 17]
response: the purpose of gba is to enable the establishment of a bootstrapped security association also referred to as bootstrapping usage between a networkbased function naf and a ue based on 3gpp authentication credentials.
reference: to enable application functions to establish shared cryptographic material.

user_input: What is the purpose of the Small Data Transmission (SDT) feature in NR? [3GPP Release 17]
response: sdt allows mtc devices to transmit small amounts of data without impacting the network.
reference: to enable data transmission in the rrcinactive state for ues with infrequent data traffic.

user_input: What functionality does Signalling Based Activation provide? [3GPP Release 17]
response: signalling based activation sba is a functional group that is responsible for establishing n1 n2 or n3 interfaces based on the delivery of signalling between network functions and user equipment ue.
reference: request for end user service performance information for one specific ue.

user_input: What are the enhancements for idle/inactive-mode UE power saving in NR? [3GPP Release 17]
response: paging enhancements are supported to reduce ue reception power consumption in idleinactive mode such as a ue shall monitor pdcch in its po for paging if the subgroup to which the ue belongs is paged as indicated via associated paging early indication pei.
reference: paging enhancements to reduce ue reception power consumption.

user_input: How does a Multi-USIM UE indicate to the network that it does not accept the paging and requests to return to CM-IDLE state? [3GPP Release 17]
response: a multiusim ue indicates that it does not accept the paging and requests to return to cmidle state by sending a service request message containing the reject paging indication to the paging network according to information 2.
reference: by sending a reject paging response to the network.

user_input: What is the purpose of the Slice-Maximum Bit Rate (S-MBR)? [3GPP Release 17]
response: the smbr is a policy data parameter pdp value indicating a maximum aggregate uplink and downlink throughput for a given snssai.
reference: to limit the aggregate data rate per ue across all qos flows for all pdu sessions associated with a slice.

user_input: What aspects of the Disaster Roaming service are specified in TS 22.011 and TS 22.261? [3GPP Release 17]
response: ts 22011 specifies that when a plmn with disaster condition is notified of the disaster condition and the ue selects the other plmn providing disaster roaming service then the ue shall perform the registration procedure in order to be registered to the plmn it also describes that the 3gpp system shall be able to collect charging information for a disaster inbound roamer ts 22261 specifies that the plmn providing disaster roaming service shall be able to limit the area of service to inbound disaster roamers to the region with disaster condition and collect charging information with information about the applied disaster condition.
reference: service requirements for the 5g system.

user_input: What is the purpose of the Provision of potential TRS/CSI-RS occasion(s) to idle/inactive-mode UEs? [3GPP Release 17]
response: the provision of trs occasions to idleinactivemode ues in general idle mode helps these ues to determine the available trs occasions in the general idle mode drx cycle.
reference: to reduce ue power consumption for synchronization.
